filterExplain: Besides filter by any word character you want, you can also use the following table to special filters:
filterExplainRegex: The filter mechanism is quite open, it's a superset of a standard called regular expression or regex
Why_hint: Why the story happens in the first place? What are the circunstances that led to the story?
Dialogs_hint: Which dialogs will happen during the story? How are the voices?
Points of view_hint: What are the different points of views in the story?
Purpose_hint: What is the objective of the story?
Protagonists_hint: Who help to achieve the objective and how?
Antagonists_hint: Who blocks to flow of the story and how?
Chronological_hint: How is the story evolving in time, is always chronological? Does the story have flashbacks or flashforwards?
Scenarios_hint: Describe the scenarios where the story will happen
Scene name_hint: Give a name to the drama cycle
Expose_hint: Create the scenes that present the story and introduce the major characters
Incident_hint: What are the moments that triggers the action to start?
Rising action_hint: The problems, the situations of conflict or tension, that will accumulate during the story
Climax_hint: It's the point where the last little bit of tension is added to the story
Falling action_hint: Situations where the listener is hinted to guess how the story will be solved
Resolution_hint: The listener discovers how the characters solved the problem
Draft_hint:
Show don't tell, create drama, show things without really telling explicitly.
 For example, tell your corporal feelings instead of simply saying that you are in love.
 The persons should revelate themselves gradually,
 and don't need to know the narrator in the beginning,
but in the end the narrator should know more about the persons that they know themselves
Resume_hint: Resume, like a game of removing words without losing the sense of the story
Draft Refined_hint:
Enhance the resume
Add details, and take the opportunity to distribute the drama in the story,
If the story is super logical see where the not logical part fits well
to equilibrate the story
Character name_hint: Who is this character that is involved in the story?
Relations_hint: How this character relate with others?
Objective_hint: What is the objective of this character?
Characteristics_hint: What are the key characteristics of this character and how he/she distinguish from the other? Are this character simple or hard to decode?
Evolution_hint: How this character develops and evolve during the story
Title: Title
Title_hint: What is the title of the story?
about_feedback: For any feedback about the app, or any feature that would help you to make better stories, please send a message on facebook
about_partnerships: If you want any advertisement partnership or that I develop your app idea, please contact me on linkedin
